bug.author: Alvant
bug.summary: Signature of apply_sparse_mask method in MultiheadAttention
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>ğŸ› Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
In MultiheadAttention module, method signature <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/modules/multihead_attention.py#L445>https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/modules/multihead_attention.py#L445</denchmark-link>
is invalid (but it still works). It is written like a function, not a class method. I suggest fixing the signature from def apply_sparse_mask(attn_weights, ... to def apply_sparse_mask(self, attn_weights, ... and the line <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/modules/multihead_attention.py#L320>https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/modules/multihead_attention.py#L320</denchmark-link> from attn_weights = MultiheadAttention.apply_sparse_mask(...) to attn_weights = self.apply_sparse_mask(...) Why am I suggesting using an instance method instead of a class- or staticmethod? I noticed that SparseMultiHeadAttention redefines this method <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/modules/sparse_multihead_attention.py#L101>https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/modules/sparse_multihead_attention.py#L101</denchmark-link> . So it seems that signature would be more appropriate to use in MultiheadAttention. <denchmark-h:h3>P.S.</denchmark-h>
It is not quite a bug, but it is something not quite right. <denchmark-h:h3>P.P.S.</denchmark-h>
If the idea is OK, I could make a pullrequest.
